Located in the Sahyadri hill ranges, Matheran may be the nearest hill station to Mumbai. It really is found in the Raigad district of Maharashtra. It really is at a height of approximately 803 meters above the sea level. There is certainly a narrow railway line that joins Matheran to Neral. 
A strict ban of motor vehicles is imposed in Matheran. It is thus a rather quiet and peaceful place. There are numerous visitors who visit the place from a number of different places but this does not spoil the serenity regarding the place. The innumerable lookout points, hills and surrounding valleys comprise the wonderful Matheran sight-seeing. 
Matheran is actually a plateau with a quite dense forest cover. There are several places to find out in Matheran and contains a nice weather throughout the year because of the fact it is a hill station. The nights within the place become very chilly. But, overall the current weather is a simple and enjoyable one. 
Post-monsoon is the better time to visit the place. It appears to be amazingly beautiful during those times of the season with lush green fields, soothing and breath-taking waterfalls plus the water-filled lakes. The time span this is certainly better to visit is thus enough time between September to November and February to March. The month of December and January can be quite chilly. The people of Mumbai are frequent visitors to the place all around the year. They enjoy within the place with their families included in relaxation or a fun and soothing outing. It's also a great location for yoga, retreats and meditation. 
The entry fee to Matheran is a nominal one with something around Rs. 50 for adults and half the cost for the kids. Through this money the management upkeeps the place considering the fragile ecosystem it offers. There are numerous trains as possible take so that you can reach the area. You can either catch the Karjat bound train or perhaps the Deccan express from the Chhatrapati Shivaji Terminus. Also, a toy train runs from Neral Station for four times each and every day. It is not a very reliable option since it closes down in the face of some upcoming perceived hazard. 
One other option which can be taken is certainly going by car. Cars are prohibited inside Matheran. But, it's possible to drive as much as a specific point, park your car or truck when you look at the parking lot and take a shuttle after that onwards. If you park at the Dasturi car point, it is possible to take a horse-back or an ordinary rickshaw to Matheran. It is a muddy track from there on. Additionally, you will run into many walking trails that ascend the plateau. These are generally taken because of the locals who go directly to the put on a normal basis or by other holiday-makers as part of trekking. Starting from the western side offers you the advantage of preventing the sun right on top of you. The ascent takes a couple of hours or so.
